Sorry, the page you were trying to view: Sorry, the page you were trying to view does not exist.
banner.phaseText: This is a new service. Your feedback helps us improve it.
banner.warning: Warning! This is a prototype. It won't actually submit your report to the RCMP.
businessPage.business: Describe the impact of the crime on your business.
businessPage.intro: Help us learn more about what they were after so that we can help protect other businesses.
businessPage.title: How was your business affected?
confirmationPage.contactIntro: Provide your contact details so that we can send you a confirmation of your report.
confirmationPage.howDidItStart.title: How did it start?
confirmationPage.impactIntro: Tell us how the scam impacted you so that we can better support other people who are affected.
confirmationPage.location.title: Location
confirmationPage.suspectIntro: Share any details you may know so that police can try to identify suspects.
confirmationPage.title: Review your report
confirmationPage.whatHappened.nag: Tell us about your experience so we can stop it from happening again.
confirmationPage.whatHappened.title: What happened?
contactinfoPage.intro: We do not follow up with everyone who submits a report.
contactinfoPage.nextInfo: Next, you will be asked to review your report.
contactinfoPage.title: Your contact details
devicePage.deviceOrAccount: What type of devices or accounts were affected?
devicePage.deviceOrAccountExample: For example: iPhone 7, banking account, wireless network
devicePage.intro: Help us learn more about what they were after so that we can help protect others from having devices or accounts compromised.
devicePage.nextPage: Next, you will be asked to provide more detail about what happened.
devicePage.tellUsMoreExample: Include details about how they compromised your devices or accounts.
devicePage.title: How were your devices or accounts affected?
evidencePage.detail1: Screenshots of webpages, conversations, or email threads.
evidencePage.detail2: Images of receipts, transations, or packing slips.
evidencePage.detail3: Recordings of the demands made by the suspect.
evidencePage.details: Think about including things such as:
evidencePage.intro: It’s okay if you didn’t keep any documentation of the crime. You can skip to the next section.
evidencePage.nextPage: Next, you will be asked for your location.
evidencePage.title: Supporting evidence
howDidItStartPage.intro: Anyone can experience a computer crime or scam. Criminals use a number of techniques to get what they want.
howDidItStartPage.nextPage: Next, you will be asked about what was affected.
howDidItStartPage.title: How did the crime start?
howDidTheyReachYou.question: Where did the suspect reach you?
howDidTheyReachYou.reminder: Select all the ways that they contacted you.
howDidTheyReachYouLabel.hint2: Enter the suspect’s phone numbers that appeared on call display.
howDidTheyReachYouLabel.hint3: Enter the website links used by the suspect.
howDidTheyReachYouLabel.hint4: Enter the names of the applications.
howDidTheyReachYouLabel.question1: What email address was it from?
howManyTimes.label: How many times did this happen?
impactPage.detail: What was the impact of the scam?
impactPage.example: For example: the amount of money, the information taken, what else was affected
impactPage.intro: You're not the only one affected by this scam. Help protect others by telling us how the scam affected you.
impactPage.summary: Tell us more about how it impacted you.
impactPage.title: Impact caused by the scam
informationPage.backButton: Back to What could be affected?
informationPage.intro: Help us learn more about what they were after so that we can help protect others from losing information and data.
informationPage.nextStep: Next, you will be asked to provide more detail about what happened.
informationPage.tellUsMoreExample: Include details about  how they obtained information.
informationPage.title: How was your information or data affected?
informationPage.typeOfInfoObtained: What type of information did they obtain?
informationPage.typeOfInfoObtainedExampl: Select the types of information taken.
informationPage.typeOfInfoReq: What type of information did they ask for?
informationPage.typeOfInfoReqExample: Select the types of information requested.
landingPage.intro: Your report helps the RCMP learn about these crimes and helps police across Canada track down cybercriminals.
landingPage.required0: Before you start, gather any evidence about the crime or scam:
landingPage.required2: Details about what could be affected
landingPage.required4: Clues on who the suspect might be
landingPage.title: Report a computer crime or scam
locationPage.intro: We use your location to link your report to other reports in your area.
locationPage.title: Your location
locationinfoPage.nextPage: Next, you will be asked for your contact details.
moneyLostPage.backButton: Back to What could be affected?
moneyLostPage.demandedMoney: How much money did they ask for?
moneyLostPage.intro: Help us learn more about what they were after so that we can help protect others from losing money.
moneyLostPage.methodPayment: How was money sent to them?
moneyLostPage.methodPaymentExample: For example: e-transfer, gift cards, credit card
moneyLostPage.moneyTaken: How much money did they get?
moneyLostPage.nextStepDetail: Next, you will be asked to provide more detail about what happened.
moneyLostPage.tellUsMoreExample: Include details about how they got money.
moneyLostPage.title: How were your money or finances affected?
nextStepsPage.helpResource1: Talk to someone and get support
nextStepsPage.helpResource2: Find tips to protect yourself in the future
nextStepsPage.nextStepDetail: The RCMP will analyze your report and combine it with others that are similar to help police across Canada track down cybercriminals.
nextStepsPage.otherReportOption1: Report directly to the place where the scam happened.
nextStepsPage.otherReportOption2: Report to your financial institution, if you lost money.
nextStepsPage.otherReportOption3: Report to the credit bureaus, <0>Equifax</0> and <1>TransUnion</1>, if your identity was stolen.
nextStepsPage.summary: We've sent you an email with a summary of your report. Your reference number is <0>#NC300234234</0>.
nextStepsPage.title: Thank you for reporting
privacyConsentInfoForm.nextPage: Next, you will be asked about how the crime started.
privacyConsentInfoForm.optionsHelpText: It may also be shared with police and other security partners to solve crimes, educate the public, and improve this service.
privacyConsentInfoForm.yes: I accept the terms of the Privacy statement.
privacyConsentPage.intro: The RCMP's new National Cybercrime Coordination Unit and the Canadian Anti-Fraud Centre will assess your report.
privacyConsentPage.title: Your privacy
scammerDetail.detail1: Who the scammer claimed to be
scammerDetail.detail2: Where they asked you to send things
scammerDetail.detail3: What language they used to communicate
scammerDetail.details: Think about including things such as:
scammerDetail.intro: Any clues about the source of the scam can help police track down the scammer.
scammerDetail.reminder: Remember to include any email addresses, phone numbers, or website links
scammerDetail.summary: What do you know about where the scam came from?
scammerDetail.title: Add suspect clues
suspectClues.intro: It's often hard to tell who is behind a crime. It's okay if you don't know much about the suspect. You can leave the questions you cannot answer blank.
suspectClues.question1: Who did they claim to be?
suspectClues.question1Details: Include any name, username, group, or organization they mentioned.
suspectClues.question2: Where did they ask you to send things?
suspectClues.question2Details: Include any addresses where you were asked to send money or information.
suspectClues.question3: What other details do you recall?
suspectClues.question3Details: Think about including any clues such as the time of day, the language they used to communicate, or some other detail that could help identify the suspect.
suspectClues.title: Suspect clues
suspectClues.whatComesNext: Next, you will be asked about supporting evidence.
thankYouPage.helpResource1: Talk to someone and get support.
thankYouPage.helpResource2: Find tips to protect yourself in the future.
thankYouPage.helpResource3: Stay up-to-date on what scams and crimes are most common.
thankYouPage.otherReportOption1: Report directly to the place where the crime happened.
thankYouPage.otherReportOption2: Report to your local police service, if you feel you are in immediate danger.
thankYouPage.otherReportOption3: Report to your financial institution, if you lost money.
thankYouPage.otherReportOption4: Report to both credit bureaus, <0>Equifax</0> and <1>TransUnion</1>, if your identity was stolen.
thankYouPage.safelyCloseWindow: You can safely close this window
thankYouPage.summary: We've sent you an email with a summary of your report.
thankYouPage.title: Thank you for reporting
timeFramePage.intro: It’s okay if you don’t know exactly when it took place. You can give your best guess or leave this blank.
timeFramePage.title: When did the scam happen?
whatHappenedPage.backButton: Back to What could be affected?
whatHappenedPage.hint: Start at the beginning. Remember to include what they asked for, promised, stole, or threatened to do.
whatHappenedPage.intro1: What happened is not your fault. These crimes are not always easy to recognize and new ones are invented every day.
whatHappenedPage.nextPage: Next, you will be asked about suspect clues.
whatHappenedPage.title: What happened?
whatWasAffectedForm.nextPage: Next, you will be asked to provide more detail about what was affected.
whatWasAffectedForm.optionsHelpText: Select all the options that could be affected as a result of this crime.
whatWasAffectedPage.backButton: Back to How did the crime start?
whatWasAffectedPage.intro: You're likely not the only one affected by something like this. Help us learn more about what the criminal was after.
whatWasAffectedPage.title: What could be affected?
whenDidItStart.label: When did it start?
